com.paypal.merchant.sdk

Interface TransactionController


  • public interface TransactionController
    The TransactionController defines an interface that can be used by the application install a callback object that is used to customize behavior. TransactionControllers are set on the TransactionManager on a per transaction basis. Unlike persistent listeners that are registered with the manager object, TransactionControllers are "forgotten" by the SDK at the end of each transaction (regardless of success or failure). TransactionControllers interact with the SDK by using the TransactionControlAction and also via the parameters passed into the callbacks. For example, the value ABORT indicates that the application has taken over processing and that the SDK should stop processing this particular transaction at this state. The CONTINUE flag indicates that the application has either made changes to the input object or left everything untouched and that the SDK should continue processing the transaction.

    • Method Detail

      • onPreAuthorize

        TransactionController.TransactionControlAction onPreAuthorize(Invoice inv,
                                                              String preAuthJSON)
        onPreAuthorize This callback is invoked by the TransactionManager in response to a call to the processPaymentWithSDKUI() API in the TransactionManager. As soon as the TransactionManager is ready to perform the authorization this callback is invoked. The SDK is responsible for ensuring that this call is invoked in the appropriate thread.
        Parameters:
        inv - This is the Invoice object against which the authorization will be performed. At this point the application can choose to make some changes to the invoice. For example, a tip could be added to an Invoice at this time or an item could be removed etc.
        preAuthJSON - Stringified JSON that represents the request payload. This is the request data that will be sent to the backend and the application is allowed to modify this data. CAUTION: Modifying the data incorrectly could cause your transaction to fail. Ensure that any changes by the app will not introduce errors and that you handle the error cases appropriately. More documentation on what the server expects in the payload can be found in the documentation.
        Returns:
        TransactionControlAction. Return ABORT if you want the SDK to stop processing the transaction at this point If ABORT is returned, then the Transaction will be canceled but the application is free to keep the invoice around if it so wishes. If the invoice is not required then use the cancel method defined on the Invoice to cancel it. Return CONTINUE if you wish the SDK to continue processing this transaction.

      • onPostAuthorize

        void onPostAuthorize(boolean didFail)
        onPostAuthorize This callback is invoked by the TransactionManager once authorization is complete. Note that authorization complete does not indicate success. The input parameter indicates whether or not the authorization failed.
        Parameters:
        didFail - - indicates whether the authorization failed. A true indicates that the authorization itself failed. A false indicates that the authorization did not fail. It however, DOES NOT indicate that the transaction was successful.

      • onPrintRequested

        void onPrintRequested(android.app.Activity activity,
                      Invoice invoice)
        When the user requests to print the receipt, this function will be called and it will be the implementation class responsibility to take the necessary action or ignore.
        Parameters:
        activity: - Current foreground activity which can be used to start new activities if needed
        invoice - Invoice object which contains all the necessary data to print the receipt.

      • getCurrentActivity

        android.app.Activity getCurrentActivity()
        This function will be called when ever sdk needs the context to show the dialogs in case of processing the payment with SDK UI
        Returns:

      • getSignatureScreenOpts

        SDKSignatureScreenOptions getSignatureScreenOpts()
        This function gets called when ever the SDK is about to show the signature screen. App can return the all the options which it want to keep it in the signature screen
        Returns:
        return the SDKTransactionScreenOptions class which holds the information about different options what app wants to have

      • getReceiptScreenOptions

        SDKReceiptScreenOptions getReceiptScreenOptions()
        This function gets called when ever the SDK is about to show the Receipt options screen. App can return the all the options which it want to keep it in the Receipt options screen. By default SDK show email and text as options. If app needs to show more, then it can pass those in SDKTransactionScreenOptions.
        Returns:
        return the SDKTransactionScreenOptions class which holds the information about different options what app wants to have

      • onUserPaymentOptionSelected

        void onUserPaymentOptionSelected(TransactionController.PaymentOption paymentOption)
        This function will be called by SDK when ever user taps or inserts the card in to the connected EMV Reader.
        Parameters:
        paymentOption - the type of payment option user selected.

      • onUserRefundOptionSelected

        void onUserRefundOptionSelected(TransactionController.PaymentOption paymentOption)
        This function will be called by SDK when ever user taps or inserts the card in to the connected EMV Reader.
        Parameters:
        paymentOption - the type of payment option user selected.

      • onTokenExpired

        void onTokenExpired(android.app.Activity activity,
                    TransactionController.TokenExpirationHandler listener)

      • onContactlessReaderTimeout

        void onContactlessReaderTimeout(android.app.Activity activity,
                                TransactionController.ContactlessReaderTimeoutOptionsHandler handler)
        This function will be called by the SDK when a timeout error is received while waiting for a contactless card to be tapped.
        Parameters:
        activity - : Current foreground activity which can be used to display a dialog of some sort if needed.
        handler - : A handler indicating the SDK to take the next appropriate step in payment flow.

      • onReadyToCancelTransaction

        void onReadyToCancelTransaction(TransactionController.CancelTransactionReason cancelTransactionReason)

      • shouldPromptForTips

        TransactionController.TipPromptOptions shouldPromptForTips()
        This function would be invoked by the SDK when the `activateReaderForPayments` api is invoked by the app. If the app desires the SDK to ask and accept a tip from a customer via the reader, it should implement this method and return an option between AMOUNT and PERCENTAGE. If reader tipping is not required, the app could simply return NONE.
        Returns:
        TipPromptOptions indicating the type of tipping flow to be presented.

      • provideSignatureBitmap

        android.graphics.Bitmap provideSignatureBitmap()
        This method will be invoked by SDK when it is about to start signature page for collecting signature. If app wants to bypass the signature page, then it can provide with the bitmap of the signature in which case sdk will use this and skip the signature page. If app doesn't provide signature and returns null, then sdk will invoke the signature page to collect signature.
        Returns:
        bitmap of the signature

      • onReaderDisplayUpdated

        void onReaderDisplayUpdated(TransactionController.PresentedReaderDisplay readerDisplay)
        This function would be invoked by the SDK throughout the transaction flow (only tipping for now), indicating the current screen that is presented on the reader. The application could use this information to display any UI or add audio assistance.
        Parameters:
        readerDisplay - The current screen presented on the reader.
